text: [Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
this is Jeff Zeke line for the New York
Times this year we're seeing something
special in hockey a six foot four
teenager with a father who spent 11
years in the NBA he could have had a
great basketball career nowadays no
score there from the right point Seth
Jones flies away throw to nothing
instead scouts say 18 year old Seth
Jones could become hockey's first big
african-american star everybody's
talking about this young man and
possibly being the number one overall
you know you always have to be on your
toes you always have to be anticipating
the next player thinking about what's
gonna happen next
you know there's no no off time when
you're on the ice you know it's physical
every time you get the puck you're gonna
get hit or or what someone else has you
might give a hit I mean I might sound
bad but that's just just something that
I love to do so Seth will be a
defenseman for the United States team at
the World Junior Championship in Russia
next week because of the size factor and
his speed for just a big guy he could
skate very well coach Phil Housley says
Seth is the full package when I talk
about defense he makes that first good
pass and he can break down four checks
also he's he's got all the tools a
fundamental to a skating shooting and
passing and he's just a well-rounded
player that sort of made for today's
game because of his size Seth is also
made for basketball he just happens to
be the son of Popeye Jones who's
currently an assistant coach with the
Brooklyn Nets we caught up with Popeye
before a Nets practice at the Barclays
Center in Brooklyn I was a guy growing
up who played the only sports that was
offered to me in a small town in
Tennessee was basketball football and
baseball and you know I'm just a sports
fanatic I'm like I told my kids you know
whatever sports should play you know
just enjoy him you know they they played
lacrosse before they play you know
they've tried some football they tried
basketball obviously they tried you know
all these sports but for some reason
hockey's just really clicked them I kind
of understand why
because when we watch the game the speed
of it everybody's involved well pop I
played pro basketball with the Denver
Nuggets Seth and his two brothers spent
time playing pick-up hockey with friends
on the advice of the Colorado Avalanche
star Joe Sakic pop I hired a skating
coach to sharpen Seth's skills on the
ice and Seth was on his way now in his
first year with the Portland Winterhawks
in the Western Major Junior League
Seth is thriving with 28 points in 31
games well there have been several black
Canadian stars in the NHL African
American players are rare
Seth stands out as the only black kid on
the US team but both Seth and his dad
say that race has never been an issue on
or off the ice you know it's never been
a factor in my house you know actually
my what my wife was white so she's white
lady so you know Seth is mixed he's
white and black but races never affect
her in my house but it's been discussed
before that it you know it may come up
and I think he'll know how to handle
himself if it does you know I don't want
to be looked at as an African American
you know I want to be like that as
someone who has a good character and you
know people know me for the person I am
not you know the color focusing on race
when it comes to Seth Jones can be
misleading what Seth is really breaking
away from is the idea that tall kids
have to play basketball and sons have to
follow in their father's footsteps let
some easily always live with it was kind
of growing up as Popeyes kid and he's
starting to make his name as stuff Jones
and not Popeyes kid anymore Jacob Trouba
is also a top junior player who's played
on a national team with Seth for about a
year I'm playing with him it's just it's
easy I mean that he's always in the
right spot and he's doing the right
thing and given the park he's gonna make
good place with the NHL still locked out
Seth and his world junior teammates are
set to take center stage
now you're headed off to to Russia for
the World Junior Championship how is it
just
country at this level it's you know it's
tremendous it's a it's a great feeling
you know you have 22 guys in the locker
room all going to go over the with you
you have great chemistry with a lot of
them you know you have to stick together
as a family you have to do everything as
a team team first that's our model this
year's team first
you
